summary: Sitting here just trying to read Good Omens but the binding is kinda crap so I’m sitting here trying to not break the spine but...
body: Sitting here just trying to read Good Omens but the binding is kinda crap so I’m sitting here trying to not break the spine but also trying to see the entire page. Honestly struggling to not rip the whole fucking book apart. I see you, Crowley, I see you…

reblog.comment: Sitting here just trying to read Good Omens but the binding is kinda crap so I’m sitting here trying to not break the spine but also trying to see the entire page. Honestly struggling to not rip the whole fucking book apart. I see you, Crowley, I see you…

trail.content: Sitting here just trying to read Good Omens but the binding is kinda crap so I’m sitting here trying to not break the spine but also trying to see the entire page. Honestly struggling to not rip the whole fucking book apart. I see you, Crowley, I see you…

blog.name: whovianfloozy
blog.title: The Whovian Floozy
blog.description:
My fandom name is Beachy, and this is a multi-fandom blog. 
I'm also a multi-shipper. It's likely I do not sail your ship, but I don't wank and expect visitors to play nicely as well. That includes not adding hate or negativity to my posts, altering them to suit your own ships, or removing my original comments. If you do, you will be blocked.
IRL they call me Doctor. Yep, I'm that old. Sometimes I write things that other people watch. It's all good! I like mocha latte with bourbon. A lot.

tags: that up-and-down is harder than left-to-right
so you see it less often
plus there being the element of danger if you fall from 'up'
I like the way RTD's mind works at these things
summary: Going Up and Down in Doctor Who From the Podcast Commentary for New Earth - featuring David Tennant, Russell T. Davies...
caption:
Going Up and Down in Doctor Who

From the Podcast Commentary for New Earth - featuring David Tennant, Russell T. Davies (showrunner/writer) and Phil Collinson (producer):

RTD: Telly does left to right very easily.  All telly is left-to-right - in and out of doors, cars, left-to-right everything.  Up and down is a real cinematic thing, I think - I’m making this up - but I really do think this.  I think the more up and down we get in Doctor Who, the more exciting it gets, actually.  Depth and height is more scary than just going left-to-right being chased by a monster sort-of-stuff.  But it’s very hard
DT: Up and down is scarier than left and right.  That’s quite an interesting theory!
PC: It’s profound.
DT: I’m rather reeling with that!  It’s good!
RTD: Farce is left-to-right.  Comedy is probably left-to-right.  I’m making it up as I go along, but I do think up and down is adventure, and television rarely goes up and down full-stop because it’s harder to do.
